channel.title: Use Auxy to create ringtones
channel.description: After a few tracks I've made on Auxy, I got bored one day... So I decided to make a new project a place a bit of notices in a small sequence, and ended up with something that sounds like a ringtone. So I suddenly exported it, used a converter to change the Auxy exported .wav to a .m4r file, which is the file type for ringtones, and used that small idea out of boredom as a ringtone. So, Auxy could be used not just for making music, but for making tones for your phone as well!

item.title: Use Auxy to create ringtones
item.dc:creator: RazerFireRiot
item.description:
That works too, actually, and I’ve done that without using GarageBand. I’ve made another ringtone on the same day I made the first one with one of the songs I made on Auxy and just duplicated the project and shortened the Auxy song and then exported it as a .wav

Read full topic

item.title: Use Auxy to create ringtones
item.dc:creator: J_Cort
item.description:
You can also take full projects to crop certain part in garageband on ios and export it as a ringtone

Read full topic

item.title: Use Auxy to create ringtones
item.dc:creator: RazerFireRiot
item.description:
After a few tracks I’ve made on Auxy, I got bored one day…
So I decided to make a new project a place a bit of notices in a small sequence, and ended up with something that sounds like a ringtone.
So I suddenly exported it, used a converter to change the Auxy exported .wav to a .m4r file, which is the file type for ringtones, and used that small idea out of boredom as a ringtone.
So, Auxy could be used not just for making music, but for making tones for your phone as well!
